meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for a minimum wage at an hourly rate for certain employees; to establish a Minimum Wage Commission and to make consequential amendments to the Labour Tribunal Ordinance, the Employment Ordinance, the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board Ordinance and the Disability Discrimination Ordinance.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Minimum Wage Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

def.name: AccreditedProgramme
def.leadIn: accredited programme (經評審課程) means a full-time programme that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is provided by an education institution specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a learning programme of a kind described in section 1, 2 or 3 of Schedule 3 to the Accreditation of Academic and Vocational Qualifications Ordinance (Cap. 592); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if provided by a school registered or provisionally registered under the Education Ordinance (Cap. 279), is at the level of post secondary education (within the meaning of that Ordinance);

section.def: assessment-opting PWD (選擇受評估殘疾人士) means a PWD who, in accordance with section 4(2) of Schedule 2, has elected to have an assessment made under that Schedule of his or her degree of productivity in performing the work required under the contract of employment;
chairperson (主席) means chairperson of the Commission;
contract of employment (僱傭合約) has the same meaning as in the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57);
domestic worker (家庭傭工) means a domestic helper, carer, chauffeur, gardener, boat-boy or other personal helper employed in, or in connection with, a household;
employee (僱員) means a person engaged as an employee under a contract of employment other than a person covered by section 7(2), (3), (4) or (5);

employee with a disability (殘疾僱員) means an employee who is a PWD and whose degree of productivity in performing the work required under the contract of employment is stated in a certificate of assessment that has effect for the purposes of section 9(1)(b);
exempt student employment (獲豁免學生僱用)—see section 3;
member (委員) means member of the Commission;
minimum wage (最低工資), for an employee for a wage period, has the meaning given by section 8(2);
non-local education programme (非本地教育課程) means a full-time programme of education which leads to the award of a non-local academic qualification which is at the level of degree or higher;
option form (選擇表格) means a form referred to in section 4 of Schedule 2;

place of employment (僱傭地點), in relation to an employee, means any place at which the employee is, in accordance with the contract of employment or with the agreement or at the direction of the employer, in attendance for the purpose of doing work or receiving training;
prescribed minimum hourly wage rate (訂明每小時最低工資額) means the hourly wage rate specified in column 1 of Schedule 3;
PWD (殘疾人士) means a person who holds a valid Registration Card for People with Disabilities issued by the Central Registry for Rehabilitation established by the Government;

def.name: StudentIntern

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a student undergoing a period of work arranged or endorsed by an education institution specified in Schedule 1 in connection with an accredited programme being provided by the institution to the student; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a student resident in Hong Kong and undergoing a period of work arranged or endorsed by an institution in connection with a non-local education programme being provided by the institution to the student,

def.continued: for which the work is a compulsory or elective component of the requirements for the award of the academic qualification to which the programme leads;

section.def: trial period of employment (僱傭試工期) means a trial period of employment referred to in section 2 of Schedule 2;

def.name: WorkExperienceStudent
def.leadIn: work experience student (工作經驗學員) means a student who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is enrolled in an accredited programme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is resident in Hong Kong and enrolled in a non-local education programme,

def.continued: and who is engaged under a contract of employment at the beginning of which he or she is under the age of 26 years.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Exempt student employment
section.leadIn: A work experience student and his or her employer may agree to treat a continuous period of up to 59 days during the contract of employment (the current contract) as a period of exempt student employment if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no period during another contract of employment to which the work experience student was a party and that commenced in the same calendar year as the current contract was a period of exempt student employment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the work experience student provides to the employer before the commencement of the current contract a statutory declaration (or copy of a statutory declaration) made by him or her verifying the fact set out in paragraph (a).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Hours worked
section.leadIn: The hours worked by an employee in a wage period include any time during which the employee is, in accordance with the contract of employment or with the agreement or at the direction of the employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in attendance at a place of employment, irrespective of whether he or she is provided with work or training at that time; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: travelling in connection with his or her employment excluding travelling (in either direction) between his or her place of residence and his or her place of employment other than a place of employment that is outside Hong Kong and is not his or her usual place of employment.

subsection.content: The wage period of an employee is the period in respect of which wages are payable to the employee for work done or to be done under his or her contract of employment.
Unless the contrary is proved, that period must be taken to be one month.

For a completed or terminated contract of employment that has had at least one previous wage period, the final wage period is the period commencing at the end of the penultimate wage period and ending on the day of completion or termination of the contract.

For a completed or terminated contract of employment that has not had at least one previous wage period, the final wage period is the period commencing at the beginning of the contract and ending on the day of completion or termination of the contract.

A deduction from the wages of an employee made under section 25(3) or 32(2)(b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (ga), (h) or (i) of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57) in respect of any wage period must be counted as part of the wages payable in respect of that period. (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 18)
A payment made to an employee in any wage period for any time that is not hours worked by the employee must not be counted as part of the wages payable in respect of that or any other wage period.
An advance or over-payment of wages made to an employee in any wage period must not be counted as part of the wages payable in respect of that period.

A payment of arrears of wages in respect of an earlier wage period made to an employee in any wage period must not be counted as part of the wages payable in respect of the wage period in which it is paid.

Despite subsections (1), (3) and (4), for the purposes of this Ordinance, any commission paid, with the prior agreement of the employee, at any time after the first 7 days of a wage period but before the end of the 7th day immediately after that period must be counted as part of the wages payable in respect of that period irrespective of when the work is done or the commission is otherwise payable under the contract of employment.
Subject to this section, this Ordinance applies to every employee, his or her employer and the contract of employment under which he or she is engaged.

This Ordinance does not apply to a person to whom the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57) does not apply because of section 4(2) of that Ordinance or who is engaged under a contract of apprenticeship registered under the Apprenticeship Ordinance (Cap. 47).
This Ordinance does not apply to a person who is employed as a domestic worker in, or in connection with, a household and who dwells in that household free of charge.
This Ordinance does not apply to a student intern.
This Ordinance does not apply to a work experience student during a period of exempt student employment.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Employees to be paid at least minimum wage

subsection.content: An employee is entitled to be paid wages in respect of any wage period of not less than the minimum wage.

The minimum wage for an employee for a wage period is the amount derived by multiplying the total number of hours (including any part of an hour) worked by the employee in the wage period by the minimum hourly wage rate for the employee provided by section 9.
This section is subject to section 18 (transitional provisions).

subsection.leadIn: The minimum hourly wage rate for an employee is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a PWD undergoing a trial period of employment, the hourly rate that is the percentage specified in section 3 of Schedule 2 of the prescribed minimum hourly wage rate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an employee with a disability, the hourly rate derived by multiplying the prescribed minimum hourly wage rate by the employee’s assessed degree of productivity as stated in the certificate of assessment referred to in section 7 of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an assessment-opting PWD who continues to be employed to do the same work for the same employer, until the end of the day on which the assessment of his or her degree of productivity in performing that work is completed under Schedule 2, the hourly rate that is the percentage specified in the option form of the prescribed minimum hourly wage rate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in any other case, the prescribed minimum hourly wage rate.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1)(d), if a PWD who has undergone a trial period of employment becomes an employee with a disability after the expiry of the trial period, the minimum hourly wage rate for the employee must be taken to be the hourly rate provided by subsection (1)(b) on and from the first day after the expiry of the trial period.

Schedule 2 has effect with respect to assessing the degree of productivity of a PWD and specifying the percentage of the prescribed minimum hourly wage rate that is applicable to a PWD undergoing a trial period of employment.

Schedule 2 also provides for determining the percentage of the prescribed minimum hourly wage rate that is applicable to an assessment-opting PWD until the end of the day on which the assessment of his or her degree of productivity in performing the work required under the contract of employment is completed under that Schedule.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Entitlement to at least minimum wage under contract of employment

subsection.content: If, but for this Ordinance, the wages payable to an employee in respect of any wage period are less than the minimum wage for the employee for that period, the contract of employment of the employee must be taken to provide for all purposes that the employee is entitled to additional remuneration in respect of that period of the amount derived by subtracting from that minimum wage the amount of wages that, but for this Ordinance, is payable in respect of that period.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the purposes referred to in that subsection include calculating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of any wages or of any other sum payable under the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any amount payable by way of an ex gratia payment under the Protection of Wages on Insolvency Ordinance (Cap. 380);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of any mandatory contribution required to be paid to a provident fund scheme under the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the monthly earnings of the employee for the purposes of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282) or the Occupational Deafness (Compensation) Ordinance (Cap. 469).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt and without limiting subsection (1), the amount of any additional remuneration to which an employee is entitled under subsection (1) forms part of the wages payable to the employee under the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57) and a failure to pay it may be dealt with in the same way as a failure to pay any other portion of those wages.
A Commission is established to be known as “Minimum Wage Commission” in English and “最低工資委員會” in Chinese.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person, who is not a public officer, appointed as the chairperson;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: not more than 9 other members who are not public officers of whom—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not more than 3 must be persons who, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, have knowledge of, or experience in, matters relating to the labour sector;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not more than 3 must be persons who, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, have knowledge of, or experience in, matters relating to the business sector; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: not more than 3 must be persons who, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, have knowledge of, or experience in, a relevant academic field; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not more than 3 other members who are public officers.

subsection.content: The chairperson and all other members are to be appointed by the Chief Executive and, in appointing members under subsection (2)(b) and (c), the Chief Executive may have regard to the need for there to be a balanced number of members appointed under each of the subparagraphs of paragraph (b) of subsection (2) and under paragraph (c) of that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive must publish in the Gazette notice of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any appointment of a member made under this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any appointment of an acting chairperson made under section 3 of Schedule 4.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (4) is not subsidiary legislation.
Schedule 4 has effect with respect to the Commission.

The main function of the Commission is, when required by the Chief Executive to do so, to report to the Chief Executive in Council its recommendation about the amount of the prescribed minimum hourly wage rate.
The Commission has any other function given to it by the Chief Executive in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In performing its functions, the Commission must have regard to the need—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to maintain an appropriate balance between the objectives of forestalling excessively low wages and minimizing the loss of low-paid jobs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to sustain Hong Kong’s economic growth and competitiveness.

subsection.leadIn: Before arriving at the recommendation to be included in its report, the Commission may as it thinks fit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consult any organization representative of employers or employees or any other person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider any submission made to it in the course of its consultations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: analyse and consider any data derived from, and consider any other information contained in, any research or study.

subsection.content: The Commission has power to do all things that are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of its functions.
Without limiting subsection (1), the Commission may form a committee for any purpose.
The Chief Executive must require that a report under section 12(1) is made at least once in every 2 years.
The Chief Executive must, as soon as practicable after receiving a report made under section 12, cause a copy of it to be published.

section.name: s15
section.heading: No contracting out
section.content: A provision of a contract of employment (whether the contract was entered into before, on or after the commencement of this section) that purports to extinguish or reduce any right, benefit or protection conferred on the employee by this Ordinance is void.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 3 to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify in column 1 an hourly wage rate or increase or reduce the then current hourly wage rate specified in that column; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in column 2 the effective date for any amendment referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: In exercising a power under subsection (1), the Chief Executive in Council may have regard to any recommendation included in a report made under section 12(1) but is not bound by the recommendation.
Subsection (1) only confers power to fix a single hourly wage rate that is applicable to all employees, whether directly or as a factor in calculating their minimum wage.

subsection.leadIn: Section 34(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) applies to a notice under subsection (1) as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the words “amended in any manner whatsoever consistent with the power to make such subsidiary legislation” there were substituted the words “wholly revoked”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the words “to be amended” there were substituted the words “to be wholly revoked”.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1 or 2.
The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 4.

If the effective date of the first prescribed minimum hourly wage rate is a date after the beginning of a wage period of an employee, in calculating the minimum wage for the employee for that period no account is to be taken of any hour (including any part of an hour) worked by the employee in that period before that effective date nor of any wages payable to the employee for any such hour or part of an hour.

If the prescribed minimum hourly wage rate is increased or reduced under section 16(1) after the beginning of a wage period of an employee, in calculating the minimum wage for the employee for that period the increased or reduced rate only applies to any hour (including any part of an hour) worked by the employee on or after the effective date of the increase or reduction.
For the purposes of section 3, no account is to be taken of any period of employment that precedes the commencement of that section.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Assessment of Degree of Productivity of PWDs

def.name: ApprovedAssessor
def.leadIn: approved assessor (認可評估員) means a person who—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: is of a kind specified by the Commissioner for the purposes of this paragraph under subsection (2);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: has the length of experience in the provision of vocational rehabilitation or other services in relation to the employment of persons with a disability that is specified by the Commissioner for the purposes of this paragraph under subsection (3); and

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: is approved by the Commissioner under section 6(4) of this Schedule;

subsection.def: assessment (評估) means an assessment referred to in section 6 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify kinds of persons for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of approved assessor in subsection (1), whether by reference to the profession practised by them or the occupation or qualification held by them or on any other basis.
The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify a length of experience for the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of approved assessor in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a PWD—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: who on or after the commencement of section 9 is seeking to be engaged under a contract of employment; or

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: the terms of whose contract of employment are to be varied on or after that commencement as to the kind of work to be done under that contract.

A PWD may, if he or she chooses to do so, before commencing employment or before a variation of the terms of his or her contract of employment as to the kind of work to be done under that contract is due to take effect, agree with an employer to undergo a trial period of employment at not less than the minimum hourly wage rate provided by section 9(1)(a).
The purpose of the trial period is to provide an opportunity for an assessment to be made of the degree of productivity of the PWD.

Subject to subsection (5), the length of the trial period is 4 weeks or until the end of the day on which the assessment of the degree of productivity of the PWD is completed, whichever period is the shorter.

On an application made to the Commissioner jointly by the PWD and the employer before the end of the trial period, the Commissioner may, in exceptional circumstances, extend the length of the trial period applying to them by up to 4 weeks.

section.heading: Percentage of prescribed minimum hourly wage rate applicable during trial period of employment
section.content: For the purposes of section 9(1)(a), the specified percentage is 50%.

section.heading: PWDs employed before commencement may opt for an assessment

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was employed immediately before the commencement of section 9;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to be employed to do the same work for the same employer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is employed at an hourly wage rate that is less than the first prescribed minimum hourly wage rate,

subsection.continued: may, before the effective date of the first prescribed minimum hourly wage rate, elect to have his or her degree of productivity in performing the work required under the contract of employment assessed under this Schedule.

subsection.content: An election is made by the employee signing an option form and giving it to his or her employer as soon as practicable after signing it.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the form approved by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the hourly wage rate (the current contractual rate) at which the PWD is then employed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the percentage of the first prescribed minimum hourly wage rate that the current contractual rate represents.

subsection.content: The employer must countersign the option form before the effective date of the first prescribed minimum hourly wage rate and give a copy of it to the employee as soon as practicable after doing so.
This section is subject to section 6(6) of this Schedule.

section.heading: Other employees may opt for an assessment

subsection.content: An employee who is a PWD (other than a PWD to whom section 2 of this Schedule applies who has chosen to undergo a trial period of employment or a PWD who is an assessment-opting PWD) may at any time, if he or she chooses to do so, seek to have his or her degree of productivity in performing the work required under the contract of employment assessed under this Schedule.
This section is subject to section 6(6) of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an assessment under this Schedule with respect to the following employees—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a PWD who has chosen to undergo a trial period of employment under section 2 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an assessment-opting PWD;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a PWD covered by section 5 of this Schedule who has chosen to have an assessment made.

subsection.content: The purpose of an assessment is to determine the degree (if any) to which the productivity of the PWD in performing the work required under the contract of employment is affected by a disability.

The assessment must be made by an approved assessor at a time agreed by the PWD and his or her employer. For a PWD who has chosen to undergo a trial period of employment under section 2 of this Schedule, that time may be within the trial period of employment or after the expiry of that period.

The Commissioner may, in writing, approve an assessor who satisfies the requirements of paragraphs (a) and (b) of the definition of approved assessor in section 1(1) of this Schedule for the purpose of making assessments under this Schedule.
The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify methods of assessment for the purposes of this Schedule.
A PWD in respect of whom an assessment of his or her degree of productivity has been completed cannot have any further assessment made for the same work with the same employer.

An approved assessor who makes an assessment of the degree (if any) to which the productivity of the PWD in performing the work required under the contract of employment is affected by a disability must provide to the PWD and the employer a certificate of assessment.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the degree of productivity capable of being achieved by the PWD in performing the work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the form approved by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be signed by the approved assessor.

subsection.content: The assessment of the degree of productivity of the PWD is completed for the purposes of this Ordinance when the certificate of assessment is signed by the approved assessor.

The PWD and the employer must countersign the certificate provided to them under subsection (1). On and from the first day after their doing so the certificate has effect for the purposes of section 9(1)(b).
The countersigning by the PWD or the employer of a certificate of assessment must not be taken to indicate any agreement on their part to continue the employment relationship.

section.heading: Status of approved assessor
section.content: In making an assessment under this Schedule, an approved assessor (other than a public officer doing so in his or her capacity as a public officer) is neither a servant nor an agent of the Government.

section.heading: Terms and conditions of appointment of members

subsection.leadIn: A member who is not a public officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds office for the term that is specified in his or her instrument of appointment and on any other terms and conditions of appointment that the Chief Executive may from time to time determine; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive.

subsection.content: A member who is a public officer holds office at the discretion of the Chief Executive.
A member is eligible for reappointment.
A resignation under subsection (1)(b) takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date the Chief Executive receives the notice.

section.heading: Removal of members
section.content: The Chief Executive may, by notice in writing, remove from office a member who is not a public officer if the Chief Executive is satisfied that the member is unable or unfit to carry out the duties of the office due to permanent incapacity or other sufficient cause.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may appoint another member who is not a public officer to act as chairperson—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during a vacancy in the office of chairperson; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: while the chairperson is absent from Hong Kong or is, for any other reason, unable or unfit to carry out the duties of the office of chairperson.

subsection.content: An acting chairperson has and may exercise all the powers, and must carry out all the duties, of the office of chairperson.

subsection.leadIn: Anything done by or in relation to a person purporting to act as chairperson is not invalid merely because—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there was a defect or irregularity in, or in connection with, the acting appointment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the occasion for the person to act had not arisen or had ceased.

subsection.content: Meetings of the Commission are to be held at the times and places appointed by the chairperson.
The chairperson must preside at a meeting of the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: The quorum for a meeting of the Commission is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person presiding; plus

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than half of the other members in office for the time being including at least 3 members who are not public officers and at least one who is.

subsection.content: Subject to this Schedule, the Commission may regulate its own procedure.

section.heading: Status of Commission
section.content: The Commission is neither a servant nor an agent of the Government and does not enjoy any status, immunity or privilege of the Government.
